channel.title: Posts on Charlie Patterson
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Charlie Patterson

item.title: Getting Acquainted with HTTP
item.description: Tim Berners Lee, the leader of a group at CERN that developed http, looking fondly upon his creation at work.

item.title: Recurse Center: Day 25
item.description: Four weeks of (Virtual) Recurse Center will have pasted Friday. How has the experience been so far? Am I getting the most out of RC?

item.title: Recurse Center: Day 1
item.description: This is the first in a series of posts to record and reflect on my experience at Recurse Center(RC) in NYC (now virtual).

item.title: Counting Files and Comparing Directories in Linux
item.description: I’ve been exploring the /usr directory as a part of a mission to better understand the Linux Filesystem Hierarchy Standard — the topography of the modern server.

item.title: Using Regex for Messy Webscraping
item.description: People have strong feelings about using regex for parsing html. I understand. When things are as they should be, scraping html using xpaths or css selectors is way better.

item.title: Deduplication with Fuzzywuzzy and Stanford CoreNLP
item.description: Find and eliminating duplicates is an important part of data collection. For a few weeks now I’ve been helping an organization in New York collect official reports on corruption in China.
